taskInfo.topic: The History of Web3 Infrastructure: From IPFS to The Graph

events.description: The internet itself was designed around principles of decentralization, allowing an unknown network of machines to be organically connected, addressed, and updated over time without a central administration.

sources.original_description: The internet itself was designed around principles of decentralization, allowing an unknown network of machines to be organically connected, addressed, and updated over time without a central administration.
sources.source_text_snippet: The internet itself was designed around principles of decentralization, allowing an unknown network of machines to be organically connected, addressed, and updated over time without a central administration.

events.source_text_snippet: The internet itself was designed around principles of decentralization, allowing an unknown network of machines to be organically connected, addressed, and updated over time without a central administration.

events.description: The rise of cloud computing and large platforms that served the needs of Web 2.0 led to a recentralization of the internet around those services.

sources.original_description: The rise of cloud computing and large platforms that served the needs of Web 2.0 led to a recentralization of the internet around those services.
sources.source_text_snippet: The rise of cloud computing and large platforms that served the needs of Web 2.0 led to a recentralization of the internet around those services.

events.source_text_snippet: The rise of cloud computing and large platforms that served the needs of Web 2.0 led to a recentralization of the internet around those services.

events.description: BitTorrent and other peer-to-peer filesharing networks are one of the earliest successful decentralized protocols, allowing for file sharing and storage without a central archive, and allowing large files to be shared by many participants who could not store it in its entirety.

sources.original_description: BitTorrent and other peer-to-peer filesharing networks are one of the earliest successful decentralized protocols, allowing for file sharing and storage without a central archive, and allowing large files to be shared by many participants who could not store it in its entirety.
sources.source_text_snippet: BitTorrent and other peer-to-peer filesharing networks are one of the earliest successful decentralized protocols, allowing for file sharing and storage without a central archive, and allowing large files to be shared by many participants who could not store it in its entirety.

events.source_text_snippet: BitTorrent and other peer-to-peer filesharing networks are one of the earliest successful decentralized protocols, allowing for file sharing and storage without a central archive, and allowing large files to be shared by many participants who could not store it in its entirety.

events.description: Blockchain networks are a more recent example of decentralized tools and systems, in particular built on low-trust networks and transactions.

sources.original_description: Blockchain networks are a more recent example of decentralized tools and systems, in particular built on low-trust networks and transactions.
sources.source_text_snippet: Blockchain networks are a more recent example of decentralized tools and systems, in particular built on low-trust networks and transactions.

events.source_text_snippet: Blockchain networks are a more recent example of decentralized tools and systems, in particular built on low-trust networks and transactions.

events.description: Gavin Wood was one of the founders of the Ethereum blockchain.

sources.original_description: Gavin Wood was one of the founders of the Ethereum blockchain.
sources.source_text_snippet: He was one of the founders of the Ethereum blockchain, which he has described as "one computer for the entire planet," with Vitalik Buterin, Charles Hoskinson, Anthony Di Iorio, and Joseph Lubin during 2013–2014.

events.source_text_snippet: He was one of the founders of the Ethereum blockchain, which he has described as "one computer for the entire planet," with Vitalik Buterin, Charles Hoskinson, Anthony Di Iorio, and Joseph Lubin during 2013–2014.

events.description: The concepts of web3 were first represented.

sources.original_description: The concepts of web3 were first represented.
sources.source_text_snippet: The concepts of web3 were first represented in 2013.

events.source_text_snippet: The concepts of web3 were first represented in 2013.

events.description: The term "web3" was coined by Polkadot founder and Ethereum co-founder Gavin Wood, referring to a "decentralized online ecosystem based on blockchain."

sources.original_description: The term "web3" was coined by Ethereum co-founder Gavin Wood.
sources.source_text_snippet: The term "web3" was coined in 2014 by Ethereum co-founder Gavin Wood, and the idea gained interest in 2021 from cryptocurrency enthusiasts, large technology companies, and venture capital firms.

sources.original_description: The term "web3" was coined by Polkadot founder and Ethereum co-founder Gavin Wood, referring to a "decentralized online ecosystem based on blockchain."
sources.source_text_snippet: The term "web3" was coined by Polkadot founder and Ethereum co-founder Gavin Wood in 2014, referring to a "decentralized online ecosystem based on blockchain."

events.source_text_snippet: The term "web3" was coined in 2014 by Ethereum co-founder Gavin Wood, and the idea gained interest in 2021 from cryptocurrency enthusiasts, large technology companies, and venture capital firms.

events.description: Gavin Wood released the paper defining the Ethereum Virtual Machine.

sources.original_description: Gavin Wood released the paper defining the Ethereum Virtual Machine.
sources.source_text_snippet: He also released the paper defining the Ethereum Virtual Machine, the runtime system for smart contracts in Ethereum, in 2014.

events.source_text_snippet: He also released the paper defining the Ethereum Virtual Machine, the runtime system for smart contracts in Ethereum, in 2014.

events.description: Juan Benet founded Protocol Labs.

sources.original_description: Juan Benet founded Protocol Labs.
sources.source_text_snippet: IPFS was created by Juan Benet, who later founded Protocol Labs in May 2014.

events.source_text_snippet: IPFS was created by Juan Benet, who later founded Protocol Labs in May 2014.

events.description: Parity Technologies, a blockchain infrastructure company, was founded by Gavin Wood and Jutta Steiner.

sources.original_description: Parity Technologies, a blockchain infrastructure company, was founded by Gavin Wood and Jutta Steiner.
sources.source_text_snippet: The Polkadot SDK and other core technology components are being developed by Parity Technologies, a blockchain infrastructure company founded in 2015 by Gavin Wood and Jutta Steiner.

events.source_text_snippet: The Polkadot SDK and other core technology components are being developed by Parity Technologies, a blockchain infrastructure company founded in 2015 by Gavin Wood and Jutta Steiner.

events.description: An alpha version of IPFS was launched.

sources.original_description: An alpha version of IPFS was launched.
sources.source_text_snippet: An alpha version was launched in February 2015, and by October of the same year was described by TechCrunch as 'quickly spreading by word of mouth.'

events.source_text_snippet: An alpha version was launched in February 2015, and by October of the same year was described by TechCrunch as 'quickly spreading by word of mouth.'

events.description: IPFS was described by TechCrunch as "quickly spreading by word of mouth."

events.description: Gavin Wood founded Parity Technologies (formerly Ethcore) with Jutta Steiner.

sources.original_description: Gavin Wood founded Parity Technologies (formerly Ethcore) with Jutta Steiner.

events.description: The Internet Archive and Protocol Labs began hosting a regular DWeb Summit dedicated to new technical and social communities building the decentralized web.

sources.original_description: The Internet Archive and Protocol Labs began hosting a regular DWeb Summit dedicated to new technical and social communities building the decentralized web.
sources.source_text_snippet: Starting in 2016, the Internet Archive and Protocol Labs began hosting a regular DWeb Summit dedicated to new technical and social communities building the decentralized web.

events.source_text_snippet: Starting in 2016, the Internet Archive and Protocol Labs began hosting a regular DWeb Summit dedicated to new technical and social communities building the decentralized web.

events.description: Polkadot raised over $144.3 million in its initial coin offering (ICO).

sources.original_description: Polkadot raised over $144.3 million in its Initial coin offering.
sources.source_text_snippet: The project raised over $144.3 million in its Initial coin offering in October 2017.

sources.original_description: Polkadot raised over $144.3 million in its initial coin offering (ICO).
sources.source_text_snippet: In October 2017, Polkadot raised over $144.3 million in its initial coin offering (ICO).

events.description: Gavin Wood, Aeron Buchanan, Peter Czaban, Reto Trinkler, and Mathias Bucher established the Web3 Foundation.

sources.original_description: Gavin Wood, Aeron Buchanan, Peter Czaban, Reto Trinkler, and Mathias Bucher established the Web3 Foundation.
sources.source_text_snippet: In 2017, Gavin Wood, Aeron Buchanan, Peter Czaban, Reto Trinkler, and Mathias Bucher, established the Web3 Foundation, a non-profit organization based in Zug, Switzerland, to promote and provide funding for blockchain-based decentralized web technologies.

events.source_text_snippet: In 2017, Gavin Wood, Aeron Buchanan, Peter Czaban, Reto Trinkler, and Mathias Bucher, established the Web3 Foundation, a non-profit organization based in Zug, Switzerland, to promote and provide funding for blockchain-based decentralized web technologies.

events.description: A vulnerability in the multi-signature wallets developed by Parity Technologies led to the freezing of approximately $150 million worth of Ethereum, including a significant portion of the funds raised.

sources.original_description: A vulnerability in the multi-signature wallets developed by Parity Technologies led to the freezing of approximately $150 million worth of Ethereum, including a significant portion of the funds raised.
sources.source_text_snippet: Shortly after the ICO, a vulnerability in the multi-signature wallets developed by Parity Technologies led to the freezing of approximately $150 million worth of Ethereum, including a significant portion of the funds raised.

events.source_text_snippet: Shortly after the ICO, a vulnerability in the multi-signature wallets developed by Parity Technologies led to the freezing of approximately $150 million worth of Ethereum, including a significant portion of the funds raised.

events.description: Gavin Wood held the title of chief web officer at Parity.

events.description: The Graph was launched on the Ethereum blockchain.

events.source_text_snippet: The Graph was launched on the Ethereum blockchain in 2018 by Yaniv Tal, Brandon Ramirez and Jannis Pohlman.

events.description: Phishing attacks have been distributed through Cloudflare's IPFS gateway.

events.description: The Graph raised $5 million in a token sale.

sources.source_text_snippet: In June 2020, The Graph raised $5 million in a token sale to Framework Ventures, Coinbase Ventures, CoinDesk parent Digital Currency Group, Multicoin Capital, DTC Capital, and others.

events.description: The governance of The Graph network was turned over to an independent network called The Graph Foundation.

events.description: The idea of web3 gained popularity.

sources.original_description: The idea of web3 gained popularity.
sources.source_text_snippet: In 2021, the idea of web3 gained popularity. Particular interest spiked toward the end of 2021, largely due to interest from cryptocurrency enthusiasts and investments from high-profile technologists and companies.

events.source_text_snippet: In 2021, the idea of web3 gained popularity. Particular interest spiked toward the end of 2021, largely due to interest from cryptocurrency enthusiasts and investments from high-profile technologists and companies.

events.description: Executives from venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz traveled to Washington, DC, to lobby for the idea of web3 as a potential solution to questions about regulation of the web.

sources.original_description: Executives from venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz traveled to Washington, DC, to lobby for the idea of web3 as a potential solution to questions about regulation of the web.
sources.source_text_snippet: Executives from venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz traveled to Washington, DC, in October 2021 to lobby for the idea as a potential solution to questions about regulation of the web, with which policymakers have been grappling.

events.source_text_snippet: Executives from venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz traveled to Washington, DC, in October 2021 to lobby for the idea as a potential solution to questions about regulation of the web, with which policymakers have been grappling.

events.description: Academic researchers Tomer J. Chaffer and Justin Goldston described web3 as a possible solution to concerns about the over-centralization of the web in a few "Big Tech" companies.

events.description: The Graph Foundation raised $50 million in a sale of digital tokens to investors led by Tiger Global Management.

events.description: A group of venture capital firms announced the launch of a $205 million ecosystem fund to support developers building on 'The Graph' protocol.

sources.original_description: A group of venture capital firms announced the launch of a $205 million ecosystem fund to support developers building on 'The Graph' protocol.
sources.source_text_snippet: In February 2022, a group of venture capital firms including Digital Currency Group, Multicoin Capital, Reciprocal Ventures, gumi Cryptos Capital, NGC Ventures, and HashKey announced the launch of a $205 million ecosystem fund to support developers building on ‘The Graph’ protocol.
